chat_history.content:
I'll search Wikipedia for information about The Weeknd.


Based on the Wikipedia search, I can provide you with information about The Weeknd's early life, real name, and background:

Real Name: Abel Makkonen Tesfaye (born February 16, 1990)

Early Life and Background:
- He was born and raised in Toronto, Ontario, Canada
- He is of Ethiopian descent
- Before becoming famous as The Weeknd, he released music under the aliases "the Noise" and "Kin Kane"
- The origin of his stage name "The Weeknd" comes from when he dropped out of school, took his mattress, and "left one weekend and never came home." He deliberately dropped the last 'e' from "Weekend" to avoid trademark problems with a rock band called "the Weekend"
- Early in his career, he worked at American Apparel while pursuing his music
- He started his music career in 2009 and maintained anonymity at first, with his co-workers at American Apparel listening to his music without knowing it was him
- He faced struggles early in his life, including being "basically homeless" at one point before his success
- He is known for his unconventional music production, artistic reinventions, and his signature falsetto singing voice

The Weeknd has since become one of the most successful artists in the music industry, winning numerous awards including 4 Grammy Awards, 20 Billboard Music Awards, 22 Juno Awards, and many others. He's now recognized as one of the world's best-selling music artists.

The Weeknd has since become one of the most successful artists in the music industry, winning numerous awards including 4 Grammy Awards, 20 Billboard Music Awards, 22 Juno Awards, and many others. He's now recognized as one of the world's best-selling music artists.

Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

chat_history.content:
Based on the search results, here are some key facts about The Weeknd:

1. Real name: Abel Makkonen Tesfaye
2. He is a Canadian singer, songwriter, and record producer
3. Career highlights:
- Released his influential debut mixtape "House of Balloons" in 2011
- Has won multiple Grammy Awards and other major music awards
- Performed at the Super Bowl LV halftime show in 2021
- Holds records including having the longest-charting Billboard Hot 100 song of all time with "Blinding Lights"
- Was named the world's most popular artist in 2023

4. Notable achievements:
- First Canadian artist to earn 4 Diamond Singles
- Has topped various streaming charts and broken several records
- Named one of Time's 100 Most Influential People in 2020
- Serves as a UN World Food Programme Global Goodwill Ambassador
- Has won multiple Juno Awards for Artist of the Year (2015, 2016, 2021, 2023)

5. Musical style:
- Known for R&B, pop, and alternative R&B genres
- Has East African roots that influence his music
- Started recording music under different names including The Noise and Kin Kane before becoming The Weeknd

6. Recent work:
- Starred in the HBO series "The Idol" (2023)
- Has collaborated with numerous major artists
- Continues to be one of the most successful and influential artists in contemporary music

The Weeknd has transformed from an underground R&B artist in Toronto to one of the biggest global pop stars, known for his distinctive voice, dark lyrical themes, and genre-blending music style.

**Abel Makkonen Tesfaye** (Amharic: አበል መኮነን ተስፋዬ; born February 16, 1990), known professionally as **the Weeknd**, is a Canadian singer, songwriter, and record producer.[2][3] He is noted for his unconventional music production, artistic reinventions, and his signature use of the falsetto register.[4][5] His accolades include 4 Grammy Awards, 20 *Billboard* Music Awards, 22 Juno Awards, 6 American Music Awards, 2 MTV Video Music Awards, a Latin Grammy Award, and nominations for an Academy Award and a Primetime Emmy Award.

functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

<fragment>

**Taylor Alison Swift** (born December 13, 1989) is an American singer-songwriter. Recognized for her songwriting, musical versatility, artistic reinventions, and influence on the music industry, she is a prominent cultural figure of the 21st century.


</fragment>
<fragment>

![](image)Swift's childhood home in Wyomissing, Pennsylvania
Taylor Alison Swift was born on December 13, 1989,[1] in West Reading, Pennsylvania.[2] She is named after singer-songwriter James Taylor.[3] Her father, Scott Kingsley Swift, is a former stockbroker for Merrill Lynch[4] and her mother, Andrea Gardner Swift (née Finlay), is a former homemaker who previously worked as a mutual fund marketing executive.[5] Taylor has a younger brother, actor Austin Swift,[6] and is of Scottish,[7] German, and Italian descent.[8][9] Their maternal grandmother, Marjorie Finlay, was an opera singer.[10]

At an industry showcase at Nashville's Bluebird Cafe in 2005, Swift caught the attention of Scott Borchetta, a DreamWorks Records executive who was preparing to form an independent record label, Big Machine Records. She had first met Borchetta in 2004.[44] She was one of Big Machine's first signings,[33] and her father purchased a three-percent stake in the company for an estimated $120,000.[45][46] She began working on her eponymous debut album with producer Nathan Chapman, with whom she felt she had the right "chemistry".[24] Swift wrote three of the album's songs alone and co-wrote the remaining eight with Rose, Robert Ellis Orrall, Brian Maher, and Angelo Petraglia.[47] *Taylor Swift* was released on October 24, 2006.[48] *Country Weekly* critic Chris Neal deemed Swift better than previous aspiring teenage country singers because of her "honesty, intelligence and idealism".[49] The album peaked at number five on the U.S.

Swift won multiple accolades for *Taylor Swift*. She was one of the recipients of the Nashville Songwriters Association's Songwriter/Artist of the Year in 2007, becoming the youngest person to be honored with the title.[62] She also won the Country Music Association's Horizon Award for Best New Artist,[63] the Academy of Country Music Awards' Top New Female Vocalist,[64] and the American Music Awards' Favorite Country Female Artist honor.[65] She was also nominated for Best New Artist at the 50th Annual Grammy Awards.[66] In 2008, she opened for Rascal Flatts again,[67] and dated singer Joe Jonas briefly.[68][69]

In 2013, Swift recorded "Sweeter than Fiction", a song she wrote and produced with Jack Antonoff for the *One Chance* soundtrack. The song received a Best Original Song nomination at the 71st Golden Globe Awards.[142] She provided guest vocals for Tim McGraw's song "Highway Don't Care", also featuring Keith Urban.[143] Swift performed "As Tears Go By" with the Rolling Stones in Chicago, Illinois, as part of the band's 50 & Counting tour,[144] and joined Florida Georgia Line at their set at the 2013 Country Radio Seminar to sing "Cruise".[145] Swift voiced Audrey in the animated film *The Lorax* (2012),[146] made a cameo in the sitcom *New Girl* (2013),[147] and had a supporting role in the dystopian film *The Giver* (2014).[148]
